docs.lead_paragraph: Disgruntled Chinese military veterans converged on Beijing this week in a protest over what they say is the government's failure to make good on promised pensions, medical insurance and other benefits.

headline.main: Chinese War Veterans Protest Over Missing Benefits
headline.print_headline: Chinese War Veterans Protest Over Missing Benefits

docs.snippet: Disgruntled Chinese military veterans converged on Beijing this week in a protest over what they say is the government's failure to make good on promised pensions, medical insurance and other benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: As labs and research start-ups grow, the federal government is scrutinizing their relationships with doctors, as well as their payment and billing practices.

headline.main: Pursuit of Cash Taints Promise of Gene Tests
headline.print_headline: Pursuit of Cash Taints Promise of Gene Tests

docs.abstract: Story of Renaissance RX laboratory, conducting research in personalized genetic medicine, offers window into burgeoning field of development and sales of genetic tests; Renaissance has come under scrutiny by Justice Dept regarding its billing and payment practices, and as similar labs and start-ups have cropped up, many have raised concerns about way they receive money from Medicare and also about their fiscal relationships with doctors.
docs.snippet: As labs and research start-ups grow, the federal government is scrutinizing their relationships with doctors, as well as their payment and billing practices.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and JULIE CRESWELL

docs.lead_paragraph: A committee convened by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention opted to let doctors decide on the vaccine, which is new and relatively costly.

headline.main: Health Panel Recommends Cautious Approach to Meningitis B Vaccine
headline.print_headline: Panel Recommends Cautious Approach to Meningitis B Vaccine

docs.abstract: Panel convened by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention votes, 14 to 1, electing not to explicitly recommend new vaccine against dangerous strain of Meningitis and opting instead to leave recommendation up to doctors; while strain has proved dangerous, it is relatively rare, and vaccine is costly.
docs.snippet: A committee convened by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention opted to let doctors decide on the vaccine, which is new and relatively costly.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The vote, granting President Obama enhanced power to negotiate trade pacts, was a hard-fought victory for the White House and Republican leaders.

headline.main: Trade Authority Bill Wins Final Approval in Senate
headline.print_headline: Trade Bill Wins Final Approval in Senate

docs.abstract: Senate votes to approve bill giving Pres Obama additional power to negotiate big trade agreements with Asia and Europe; vote is victory for Obama and Republican congressional leadership; focus now shifts to Trans-Pacific Partnership vote.
docs.snippet: The vote, granting President Obama enhanced power to negotiate trade pacts, was a hard-fought victory for the White House and Republican leaders.

docs.lead_paragraph: Most Americans want the Supreme Court to side with the government when it decides whether the feds can continue subsidizing insurance premiums in all 50 states under President Barack Obama's health care law, according to polls in recent months.

headline.main: 5 Things to Know About US Public Opinion on Health Care Case
headline.print_headline: 5 Things to Know About US Public Opinion on Health Care Case

docs.snippet: Most Americans want the Supreme Court to side with the government when it decides whether the feds can continue subsidizing insurance premiums in all 50 states under President Barack Obama's health care law, according to polls in recent months.

docs.lead_paragraph: Obamacare could put Republicans in a bind in the run-up to the 2016 U.S. presidential election if the U.S. Supreme Court in the next week upends part of the law designed to make healthcare accessible to all Americans, leaving millions to fend for themselves for health insurance.

headline.main: Obamacare Could Create Quandary for Republicans Before 2016 Election

docs.lead_paragraph: Greece and its international creditors are in the final phase of talks on a financing-for-reforms deal that would allow Athens to avoid defaulting on a payment to the International Monetary Fund on Tuesday.

headline.main: Factbox-What Creditors Want From Greece For in Exchange for Financing
